verses.roman:
sañcintyārī-vadhopāyaṁ
bhīmasyāmogha-darśanaḥ
darśayām āsa viṭapaṁ
pāṭayann iva saṁjñayā

synonyms: sañcintya—having thought; ari—their enemy; vadha—for killing; upāyam—about the means; bhīmasya—to Bhīma; amogha-darśanaḥ—the Supreme Lord, whose vision is infallible; darśayām āsa—showed; viṭapam—a tree branch; pāṭayan—tearing apart; iva—as if; saṁjñayā—as a sign.
translation: Having determined how to kill the enemy, that Lord of infallible vision made a sign to Bhīma by tearing in half a small branch of a tree.
